architecture.summary: TinaCMS is an open-source headless content management system that integrates directly with Git repositories, enabling seamless content management for static and dynamic sites. Built with JavaScript and React, it offers a real-time visual editing experience and utilizes a GraphQL API for content querying. TinaCMS supports both self-hosted and managed hosting options, providing flexibility for various project needs. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

targetUsers.summary: TinaCMS caters to a wide range of users, from individual developers to large enterprises, offering a flexible and user-friendly content management solution that integrates seamlessly with existing workflows. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

legal.summary: TinaCMS is released under the Apache-2.0 license, promoting open-source development and community collaboration. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

userManagement.summary: TinaCMS includes built-in user management features, allowing administrators to manage user roles and permissions within the CMS. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

contentEditing.summary: TinaCMS offers a real-time visual editing experience directly within the website, supporting custom fields and content types. It provides versioning, live previewing, and editing workflows to streamline content production, though it lacks real-time collaboration features. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

contentDisplay.summary: As a headless CMS, TinaCMS does not provide packaged themes or a theme marketplace. Frontend development is required to design and implement the presentation layer, offering flexibility in delivering content across various platforms. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

mobileSupport.summary: TinaCMS delivers content via APIs, allowing developers to build responsive designs, Progressive Web Apps (PWAs), or native mobile applications as needed. The CMS itself does not directly create these applications but serves as a backend content provider. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

internationalization.summary: TinaCMS supports internationalization, enabling the management of multilingual content, user interfaces, and editor tools, making it suitable for global audiences. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

extensibility.summary: TinaCMS is highly extensible through its plugin system, allowing developers to enhance functionality with custom plugins. Significant customizations typically require backend development expertise. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

commerce.summary: TinaCMS does not include e-commerce features in its core offering and does not provide official extensions for commerce. Integration with e-commerce platforms would require custom development to meet specific business needs. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

costs.summary: TinaCMS is free to use under the Apache-2.0 license, with no subscription or software licensing fees. Users should consider potential costs for hosting, custom development, and maintenance when planning their projects. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}
